messages.title: Fighting for the Horton General Hospital
messages.content: Victoria Prentis has been at the forefront of the campaign to save Horton General Hospital. She continues to work tirelessly to secure its future.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ensuring the Horton General Hospital remains open with uninterrupted services.
Delivering economic prosperity through supporting businesses and creating job opportunities.
Ensuring the best deal for Britain in negotiations.
Providing the best start for children through improved educational facilities and standards.
Helping people onto the property ladder and improving local infrastructure.
Protecting communities through better law enforcement and defence policies.

issues.brexitEurope: Ensuring the best deal for Britain in Brexit negotiations.
issues.defence: Protecting our communities through better law enforcement and defence policies.
issues.economy: Delivering economic prosperity through supporting businesses and creating job opportunities.
issues.education: Providing the best start for children through improved educational facilities and standards.
issues.health: Ensuring the Horton General Hospital remains open with uninterrupted services.

community.content: Helping people onto the property ladder and improving local infrastructure.

leaflet.personalStatement: Born at the Horton, Victoria is a longstanding campaigner for Banbury’s hospital services. The local choice, Victoria and her family live in the constituency. Since being elected in 2015, Victoria has voted 452 times on your behalf in Parliament. An anti-HS2 activist, Victoria works alongside local residents against the proposal. Victoria organises the National Citizen Service, takes part in the 'Banbury Spring Clean' and encourages civic pride. She regularly visits Parliament to learn more about her role.

politicalExperience.achievements: Voted 452 times on behalf of the constituency, active in anti-HS2 campaigns.

contactInformation.address: Victoria Prentis, North Oxfordshire Conservatives, Campaign Office, C/O John Taylor, Rectory Farm House, Hethe, Oxon, OX27 8ES.

images.caption: Victoria supporting independent shops at Banbury High Street at the market during the Great British High Street competition

Since being elected in 2015, Victoria has voted 452 times on your behalf in Parliament. An anti-HS2 activist, Victoria works alongside local residents against the proposal. Victoria organises the National Citizen Service, takes part in the 'Banbury Spring Clean' and encourages civic pride. She regularly visits Parliament to learn more about her role.
